column4: I'm really bummed out, I was hoping ubuntu would work for me and my nvidia... 32 bit gave me a kernal panic booting from CD, the 64 bit on a different laptop seemed to work, but everything that displays in X just creates a black shadow and nothing is clickable... I went through ctrl+alt+F1 (tty) to wget nvidia drivers, but you need to run via desktop env or it wont work, talk about chicken vs egg.
any thoughts on how I can get my desktop env working?  just really really slow, can't start anything, and freezes on each click.
disable optimus, at least for installing. then look into vgaswitcheroo
thanks for responding.  install went great.  but when it boots, the desktop environment just freezes when clicking on anythying
even if i could get a keyboard command to start a terminal window inside the desktop environment, I could run the driver package for nvidia
ctrl+alt+f1 and install it there.
thanks ... how do i restart X after install?
not totally sure since gdm uses upstart :(
service gdm stop  I guess
thats cool, worst case snario i can just do : shutdown -r now
yes. and bumblebee is unsupported 3rd party software
as you can see: yes
what do you mean "as i can see"
check what ubottu wrote last
sweet, that's the version I want, how can i tell from the tty?
tell what?
what version a package is..
that it installs this version? apt-cache policy php5  for example
dpkg -l <package> if it's already installed. apt-cache show <package> if it isn't yet
and your paypal donate link is?
this is free support. not paid support
